text: <@UEF135G05> has joined the channel
BTW if anyone ever has any suggestions for show topics, feel free to let us know
Mardu hugs
Or, more broadly, outside the box takes on color combinations. Stuff the site isn't going to show you for a commander unless you do some custom searching.
Has their been an episode where you’ve talked about your favorite decks specifically instead of in passing?
We did do one of our decks to compare to the edhrec stats, but nothing specifically on favorite decks
what's the most interesting thing you could do with me?
id be up for coming on
now that you guys got all the kinks out
How do you feel about latex and ballgags?
I mean, that's just adding kinks
He said "interesting" and "kinks"
What do you expect me to do with that, Patrick? Just leave it? :joy:
no, I'm just annoyed that you beat me to it
I was in the middle of typing up almost the same joke
:wink:

Controversial topics:

• Eminence
• The Ban List

Oh, that’s a good idea.
The future of Command Zone mechanics?

Friendly neighborhood topics:

• Favorite strategies (Hugs, Stax, Recursion, etc)
• Going against Staples (Not playing Cyclonic Rift, Tutors, etc because of how you feel about them, or because they legitimately aren't the best choice)

Risky Topics:

• Navel Gazing: Is EDHREC good for the format?
• Future of EDHREC: Statistics, where we pull from currently, where we'd like to pull from, what we think the next big thing is.
• Alternate formats: Brawl, 3DH, Pauper EDH, EDH with Planeswalkers as commanders, etc.
I like hearing stories about games you’ve played, about your play group, that sort of thing
Storytelling is fun when done well, and it might help your listeners feel more connected/on the inside with you all
That could actually be really fun.  I mean, we all love this format for the crazy shit that happens.

Also, <@U3FV90TCZ>, I hope I speak for the community at large when i say that the future of Command Zone mechanics should be no more Command Zone mechanics.

I know I don't, but I can still hope.
Command Zone mechanics are dangerous when pushed. I don’t think they’re inherently bad at least.
I think that they haven't been done very well yet

I think Experience counters were definitely the worst. Scaling with Command Tax is fine.
Eminence is probably my favorite of the major ones.
Ignoring the command zone entirely... that’s a space that I think they should’ve avoided
I think Marath and Gyrus were the best of them.
Eminence is an attempt to make something I'd hate more than partners
It failed in that regard, but it took a shot
I hate eminence the most
I’d rather they experiment with command zone mechanics and make something busted they have to ban than they make boring new commanders
They were very purposeful in this design in that it requires you to play creature of the type to gain the value.

I actually disagree about experience. The commanders were maybe too strong, but the mechanic itself is no less interactive than regular commanders. Commander Tax and Eminence are much worse in that regard. I actually hate the entire 2013 line. scaling up with the tax subtly incentivizes you to kill off your commander, derevi avoids the rules, and oloro's eminence isn't interactive at all. At least the tribal eminence require a deckbuilding restraint. Experience is solvable if you kill the commander early and often, which is what you already need to do for people's generals anyway.
But you were going to play those creatures anyway. It's a dragon/wizard/cat/vampire tribal deck
<@U3QMCLQQG>: I would say the only one that's been done well was Partner, only they pushed it too hard so they probably can't ever do it again.
<@UEF135G05> Partner was very popular and they’ve said they’ll do it again many times.
But they did do it again in Battlebond
They saw what they did wrong, tweaked it and it was cool
Possibly they'll only use the Battlebond tweaked mechanic, though
Right.
Possibly, but I wouldn’t hold my breath on that…

>I’d rather they experiment with command zone mechanics and make something busted they have to ban than they make boring new commanders

When you make strictly better commanders, it makes the format as a whole more boring.

dragon/wizard/cat/vampire is still a constraint, though.

If they do Partner again I doubt it'll be as the battlebond version
Partner With is great!
Wow, look how contentious this is. I'm sold. This would be a great podcast episode
WINNER.
It's what I do.
It’s not contentious, everyone else is just wrong
"working"
I mean…it’s only contentious because so many people don’t agree with me and are therefore wrong. The contention is how to get folks to wake up and recognize the error of their ways.
Henry gets it
<@U33EGB4TX>’s wrong and I’m right about that…even if he agrees with me.
It’s a talent of <@U33EGB4TX> ’s…
I’m declaring the Benjamin Franklin rule, I put it out there first therefore I’m right and you’ll be forgotten by the history books
My other controversial topic was The Ban List, although you guys have already gone into that a bit.  I think last week, or the week before?
Judging by your age, it seems whatever creator you believe in forgot about you too
Fortunately this and future generations don’t read books, so you’ll join me on the scrapheap

Power level of cards will almost always dictate how a mechanic is viewed.
Wizards chose to make two incredibly powerful and easy experience counter commanders (with a third very close).
The answer is to kill them early and often... but I wish that wasn’t the case.

I absolutely agree that Oloro and Derevi (and Yuriko by extension) are design mistakes.
Yuriko’s ability is much more circumscribed vs. Derevi so I’m fine with it.
You can interact with it vs. Derevi
I mostly agree, I wanted to include her because she fits into that theme. I do think her ability is a dangerous precedent because it ignores the tax, but she is must more answerable.... to a degree.
Her ability also is focused upon combat and is dependent upon creatures, the one card type all colors can deal with to some extent.
In colors that don’t do haste well either.
Point is that on its face, experience isn’t inherently flawed. Kill the commander, kill the problem. That’s typically how EDH goes
But why should I play removal if it’s not on theme?
What do you mean

Other controversial topics:

• MLD as an answer to Ramp/Fixing Boros? (It's not, that's a terrible idea, but there also aren't enough Balancing Acts to go around)
• "Durdling"
• cEDH
• Playing Reserved List cards, Collecting Reserved List Cards, the Reserved List
• Stax, Stasis, Static Orb, etc.
• Counters.dec
• Attacking at random with a die
• "Strictly Better Than" new commanders outmoding older commanders
• Rhystic Study
• "Just play more removal"
• Tuck Rule
• Proxies
• Planeswalkers as Commanders (I think you guys already did this one?)

I think that's all I've got.
Have you all done an episode about revisiting cards that were staples at one point?
ooo, that could be interesting.
So Explosive Vegetation since it’s been replaced
I could see one about edh community/playgroup/lgs
